page.title: 16HEALTH IN PAXFORD AREA
page.content: People are aware of the importance of diet and exercise. A keep fit club meets in Paxford and slimming clubs in local towns. Hospital treatment involves travel to Moreton, Shipston, Cheltenham or Stratford but ambulances and a hospital car service are available. A district nurse visits in the area but patients must travel to maternity clinics, doctors, dentists and opticians. School children have regular checks on teeth and eyes and receive innoculations by teams which visit schools.A Staywell Clinic for cervical smear tests visits the villages.special food for diabetics must be brought from local towns. For the elderly, home helps, meals on wheels and a visiting chiropodist are available. Elderly and disabled people may attend the day centre in Campden. Nearest old peoples home is at Stow.
